title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:28 <mflorea> has quit  
00:57 <florinciu> has quit  
01:08 <abusenius> has quit  
01:53 <lucaa> has quit  
03:07 <jvelo> has quit  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:31 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <Menso> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <qwebirc67998> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <qwebirc67998> has quit  
09:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <Menso> has quit  
09:12 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <lucaa> has quit  
10:04 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <@sdumitriu> Hi evalica  
10:05 <+evalica> sdumitriu: hi  
10:05 <@sdumitriu> I see you committed the form CSS, cool  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> Are you working on templates as well?  
10:06 <+evalica> sdumitriu:  :) I know you said you will ... :) but I wanted to start coding something :p  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> No problem  
10:06 <+evalica> right now.. actually I'm working on the ColorThemes  
10:06 <+evalica> I want to add the "Add" entry  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> I was on vacation anyway  
10:06 <+evalica> and then the error colors: red, green, yellow, etc  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Did you commit inline forms style as well?  
10:07 <+evalica> nope.. the inline no  
10:07 <+evalica> we didn't made a vote on them  
10:10 <+evalica> sdumitriu: I asked a question on the vote mail  
10:10 <+evalica> do you think there are problems when  
10:10 <+evalica> the templates will be modified?  
10:10 <@sdumitriu> Probably not  
10:10 <+evalica> k thanks  
10:11 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <mihaipaun> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Good morning  
10:15 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Do you want to do the default inline form + Class Wizard?  
10:15 <@sdumitriu> I'd like to do that myself  
10:16 <+evalica> please take them - I'll do the  createinline.vm, copy.vm, renameStep1.vm  
10:17 <+evalica> actually :) there are lots of places to change  
10:17 <+evalica> default inline form means... the standard?  
10:17 <+evalica> or the inline/ action?  
10:17 <@sdumitriu> inline.vm  
10:17 <+evalica> k  
10:17 <@sdumitriu> Well, there isn't much to do there, just add the class for the form element  
10:18 <@sdumitriu> But there's the class wizard in XE which has a default inline sheet for documents  
10:18 <+evalica> mflorea: raise the question when you can't change the class of the form element - where do you put the class?  
10:19 <+evalica> in the doc I've said to the nearest div that is the parent for the form components  
10:19 <+evalica> aaa.. and sdumitriu  
10:19 <+mflorea> evalica: now I think it's best to add the class to the form element in edit vm files  
10:19 <+evalica> I've added yesterday the size ... standard :P  
10:20 <+mflorea> to enforce the standard  
10:20 <+evalica> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/VerticalForms there is now a size column  
10:20 <+evalica>  <input  type="text" size="60"/>  
10:21 <+evalica> it would be great to have this ... also for IE6  
10:21 <+evalica> right now .. the elements don't take the 100% ... we can fix that by adding some rules to the ie-6.css  
10:21 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <+evalica> but would be nice to have it the size in code  
10:21 <+evalica> wdyt?  
10:22 <+evalica> mflorea: ... the edit vm change .. will reflect on all forms?  
10:22 <+evalica> aaa.. the wysiwyg form k  
10:23 <+mflorea> yes, all edit modes, including inline mode  
10:23 <+mflorea> well, we could add the xform class only for inline edit mode for now  
10:24 <+mflorea> btw, I'm planning to adapt the ConfigurableClass (used by some of the administration sections) to use the vertical form layout.  
10:25 <@sdumitriu> evalica, mflorea: +1 for the topmost editable div inside the form  
10:26 <+evalica> :) I'm so happy that you guys want to use the xforms :P just for the record  
10:26 <@sdumitriu> Sure we want, why not?  
10:26 <@sdumitriu> We want to use all the standards that you proposed  
10:26 <@sdumitriu> But it takes time to change all the existing code  
10:27 <+sburjan`> Good morning sdumitriu  
10:27 <+evalica> :) thanks thanks ... yes the code and the compatibility is hard  
10:27 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: for inline edit mode this means the sheets will have to wrap all the content with  
10:27 <+mflorea> (% class="xform" %)  
10:27 <+mflorea> (((  
10:27 <+mflorea> ## form here  
10:27 <+mflorea> )))  
10:34 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: re XAOFFICE-55 is it ok to assume that when you upload a file the input stream retrieved from the fileupload plugins has UTF-8 encoding?  
10:36 <+evalica> sburjan`: can you test accesing http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/ColorThemes/DefaultColorTheme on a snapshot 3.0 and see if in the comment tab you get the login page?  
10:37 <+evalica> sburjan`: when you are not logged in  
10:38 <+evalica> actually is the same on all browsers  
10:43 <ralucaM> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: The input stream is a byte stream, so there's no encoding  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> It's a binary file transfer  
10:47 <+evalica> sdumitriu: If I add new properties to ColorThemeClass for example - should I change their order and place them in the appropiate location? or just let them at the end of the property list?  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Yes, reorder  
10:48 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: sure, but the question is, what's the proper encoding that needs to be used to transform the byte stream to a character stream? is it ok to use UTF-8?  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Why do you want a character stream?  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Isn't the file binary anyway?  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Do you have to use a charstream?  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Can you point me to the file where this happens?  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> java file # line number  
10:49 <+mflorea> the file is uploaded, then converted to HTML by the open office server. All this time it is a byte array. But when we clean the HTML the byte array is transformed into a character array using UTF-8 hard-coded.  
10:49 <+mflorea> just a sec  
10:51 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-office/xwiki-office-importer/src/main/java/org/xwiki/officeimporter/internal/builder/DefaultXHTMLOfficeDocumentBuilder.java search for "UTF-8"  
10:51 <+mflorea> htmlReader = new InputStreamReader(htmlStream, "UTF-8");  
10:54 <+mflorea> HTML cleaner expects a reader not an input stream  
11:00 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: It depends on what encoding did OOo use when writing the HTML  
11:01 <@sdumitriu> And that might be system dependent  
11:03 <+mflorea> yep, so this can cause problems. Eugen said that he uses a russian version of open office. I guess his oo server doesn't generate the HTML using UTF-8 encoding  
11:06 <evalica> has quit  
11:07 <@sdumitriu> Is there a setting in jodconverter about the encoding?  
11:08 <+mflorea> I'm looking for one  
11:10 <@sdumitriu> http://issues.liferay.com/browse/LPS-195 ?  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> No, not relevant  
11:11 <+mflorea> yes, doesn't help because the input is office format and we don't control it  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I think you must set the output encoding of the htmlcleaner as well  
11:14 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: html cleaner generated a w3c document. wdym by "set the output encoding"?  
11:14 <@sdumitriu> Which htmlcleaner are you using?  
11:15 <@sdumitriu> org.htmlcleaner  
11:16 <+mflorea> http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-office/xwiki-office-importer/src/main/java/org/xwiki/officeimporter/internal/cleaner/OpenOfficeHTMLCleaner.java  
11:16 <+mflorea> which uses the xwiki-xml HTMLCleaner whichu uses indeed org.htmlcleaner  
11:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <@sdumitriu> OK, there's no encoding setting for htmlcleaner  
11:21 <@sdumitriu> Anyway, the cleaner returns a Document, which doesn't have an encoding  
11:21 <@sdumitriu> So, to follow the process  
11:22 <evalica> has quit  
11:22 <@sdumitriu> officeFileStream is a binary stream, no encoding needed  
11:23 <+mflorea> yep  
11:23 <@sdumitriu> htmlStream is also binary  
11:24 <@sdumitriu> So the only place where an encoding is used is here:  
11:24 <@sdumitriu> htmlReader = new InputStreamReader(htmlStream, "UTF-8");  
11:24 <@sdumitriu> So yes, the problem seems to be that OOo outputs files in the wrong encoding  
11:25 <@sdumitriu> There should be a way to tell OOo which encoding to use  
11:25 <+mflorea> yep, the it is the result of transforming the officefileStream to HTML. I'm looking over the jodconverter code and it's not clear if they operate only on byte streams. I don't think it's possible to transform the officeFileStream to HTML using only bytes.  
11:25 <@sdumitriu> You can do that from the UI when exporting documents  
11:26 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <@sdumitriu> http://www.oooforum.org/forum/viewtopic.phtml?t=96022  
11:38 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I've seen that but I can't find anything for "output encoding" and I start to thing that the oo server detects the input encoding from the input byte stream and uses the same encoding for the output.  
11:45 <+mflorea> there are some interesting threads on jodconverter group http://groups.google.com/group/jodconverter/search?group=jodconverter&q=encoding&qt\_g=Search+this+group related to encoding  
11:46 <+mflorea> most of them are complaining about converting text files, because the oo server can't determine the encoding from an input plain text file  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> http://www.oooforum.org/forum/viewtopic.phtml?t=88391  
11:46 <+mflorea> while it can detect the encoding from a doc or html input file  
11:48 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: you're last link is very useful. I can configure the document-formats.js using that info  
11:48 <evalica> has quit  
11:50 <+mflorea> have to go now, I'll try the encoding configuration later  
11:50 <mflorea> has quit  
11:50 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <evalica> has quit  
12:02 <Menso> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <+evalica> sdumitriu: ColorThemes.WizardWebColors is I add 'menuAddEntryLinkColor', 'menuAddEntryBackgroundColor' do I need to change something there? cause I don't know what is used for  
12:15 <+evalica> \*if  
12:16 <@sdumitriu> Let me check  
12:16 <@sdumitriu> WizardWebColors no  
12:17 <+evalica> thanks  
12:18 <@sdumitriu> But you must change WizardPropertyMapping and ColorThemeSheet to add it in the wizard  
12:18 <@sdumitriu> If you need help, ask me  
12:18 <+evalica> btw "force the use of the default colors whenever this theme has undefined properties" ... this should have been done with colorThemeInit.vm instead of the ColorThemes.DefaultColorTheme - because the default theme can be changed by users .. but is ok like this too  
12:18 <@sdumitriu> Right  
12:19 <@sdumitriu> Or no?  
12:19 <@sdumitriu> There is a default in colorThemeInit.vm, and there's a different default in DefaultColorTheme  
12:19 <+evalica> sdumitriu: thanks.. I can manage - did all the changes- just preparing my commit :P  
12:19 <+evalica> ColorThemes.DefaultColorTheme can be change with the wizard  
12:20 <+evalica> colorThemeInit.vm is different yes .. is the original gray theme.. but this theme was the original fallback theme  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> DefaultColorTheme should disappear  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> Be renamed to something else  
12:20 <+evalica> if you make it dissapear.. how do you show to the user.. the current Color theme?  
12:21 <+evalica> in a visual manner  
12:21 <@sdumitriu> Where?  
12:21 <+evalica> I mean.. the default is the standard one - the user should visualize the current/standard theme - you can't delete it  
12:26 <evalica> has quit  
12:45 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <jvelo> has quit  
13:44 <evalica> has quit  
13:47 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: ping  
13:47 <@sdumitriu> Pong  
13:47 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: give me some feedback on this please : http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/TranslationsTutorial  
13:48 <florinciu> has quit  
13:48 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
13:48 <@sdumitriu> I was just about to do that  
13:49 <@sdumitriu> First, I was wondering if it wouldn't be better to use the class wizard instead of doing all those steps  
13:50 <+sburjan`> I'm not aware how devs develop on top of XWiki, I chose the old school way.  
13:50 <+sburjan`> but I could change that  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> Devs always use the manual way  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> Which is bad, because we're not improving the wizard if we're not using it  
13:56 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:03 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Nice commits  
14:04 <@sdumitriu> I sent a comment on the devs list  
14:04 <+evalica> k thanks  
14:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <+evalica> sdumitriu: first choice was xe.themes.colors.wizard.menuAddEntry but then I though that I already have the components entry and Add .. and I reused them  
14:06 <+evalica> you think I should add a new entry in the translations?  
14:06 <@sdumitriu> Well, ENTRY#ADD is not that nice  
14:06 <@sdumitriu> Better just Add  
14:07 <@sdumitriu> Btw, the menu is not upper case anymore, right?  
14:07 <@sdumitriu> The color themes style should be updated  
14:07 <+evalica> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/attachment/18333/AddCustomization.png  
14:09 <+evalica> the uppercase is mixed, labels are with uppercase, user added content is not  
14:09 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Shouldn't you commit some translations as well?  
14:10 <+evalica> sdumitriu: I put entry#add to be consistent with the other 2 entries :)  
14:10 <+evalica> if I keep itlike entry#add is $msg.get('xe.themes.colors.wizard.menuEntry')#$msg.get('core.menu.create') and they are reused  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> Not for those  
14:11 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> But for the labels  
14:11 <+evalica> those are taken from the class description I think  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> "Add menu entry link color"  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> Or aren't those translated yet?  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> Hm...  
14:12 <@sdumitriu> OK, then it's bad to begin with  
14:12 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: You can help here :)  
14:12 <@sdumitriu> After completing the translations turorial, you can put it to practice by providing the keys for the colortheme wizard  
14:17 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: This sounds bad: "Before to be able to add translations, the XWiki must be set to support multiple languages."  
14:18 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: The tutorial is about translating class properties, not about translations in general, so it should be named accordingly  
14:20 <+sburjan`> okay  
14:21 <+sburjan`> I will have to talk with Marto to see exactly what she needs it for  
14:21 <+sburjan`> \*Marta  
14:29 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Step 4 should explain how those keys are obtained  
14:29 <@sdumitriu> classname + \_ + property name  
14:29 <@sdumitriu> classname + \_ + property name + \_ + property value  
14:30 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:30 <@sdumitriu> You should also explain how to translate boolean properties, and the different display types for boolean fields  
14:30 <@sdumitriu> Actually that's hidden information, ask me when you need to fill that in  
14:34 <mihaipaun> has quit
